SENT.plain: A patient who underwent redo coronary artery bypass grafting developed severe thrombocytopenia
A platelet transfusion caused recurrent hypotension and hypoxia
The patient status was complicated by a systemic thrombosis including coronary graft occlusion and central vein thrombosis
We found that the lupus anticoagulant, as well as other autoimmune antibodies, was positive only after the thrombotic episode developed
Even though the lupus anticoagulant returned to negative about 2 months after the episode of graft occlusion, the patient eventually died of heart failure
